info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 7:25AM EDT until April 7 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Kentucky River at Camp Nelson Lock affecting Garrard and Jessamine Counties.
Kentucky River at Ford Lock affecting Madison and Clark Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Kentucky River at Camp Nelson Lock.
* WHEN...From this morning to Monday evening.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT Friday the stage was 29.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 28.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this morning to 34.8 feet this evening. It will then fall tomorrow evening. It will rise to 35.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.4 feet on 02/02/1950. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING
